page.title: 11Hill and Upland Farming
page.content: There are two main types of farming in the area around Torphichen - Hill and Upland farming and Stock and Arable. Many farms in the area were dairy farms until about ten years ago but had to change because of the economic climate. The majority of the farms round this area are Hill and Upland farms because the ground is not fertile enough for crops, so it is used for rough grazing. Most of the sheep are crossbreeds of Blackface and Leicester. The reason for this crossbreeding is to produce a good-sized sturdy ewe. The lambing season is between March and April, but even in this small area there can be a time variation of about 2 to 3 weeks. The higher up you get the later the lambing.
